VFX_001.name: Dynamic Flux
VFX_001.description: A swarm of sentient particles â€” aware of your presence. As you approach, they shift, respond, and invite you in. Their colors morph from rose to green based on your distance, like an emotional pulse. It's not just VFX â€” it's a reactive entity. A coded organism.
VFX_001.author: Kentiq

VFX_002.name: Tesseract
VFX_002.description: A 3D projection of a 4D hypercube â€” the Tesseract is not just visual. It is a representation of higher-dimensional logic compressed into an artifact. Rotating, folding, evolving in space, it challenges perception and reflects mathematical purity. This is the abstract made real.
VFX_002.author: Kentiq

UXUI_001.name: 2D Kinematics
UXUI_001.description: A highly responsive and dynamic UI element simulating 2D kinematic behavior â€” curves, inertia, momentum and friction are mathematically embedded to deliver a smooth and natural user experience. Ideal for interactive menus, sliders, or visual feedback systems.
UXUI_001.author: Kentiq

SCENE_001.name: Ferrofluid Spiral
SCENE_001.description: An interactive spiral staircase made of black ferrofluid â€” shifting, flowing, and reshaping as you climb. The higher you ascend, the darker and slower it becomes, until it resets in a reverse collapse. Inspired by BayMax's black iron robot, this is a living terrain with memory and rhythm.
SCENE_001.author: Kentiq

WEB_001.name: Kentiq's Portfolio Maquette
WEB_001.description: A mockup for Kentiq's personal portfolio website, currently under development.
WEB_001.author: Kentiq

GFX_001.name: Status Effect Concept Icons
GFX_001.description: A set of concept icons for game status effects (Bleeding, Poisoned, Stun, Blind, Berserk, Silence). Inspired by Lost Ark & Black Desert Online UI.
GFX_001.author: Kentiq

GAME_001.name: Weeping Angel Dummy
GAME_001.description: A humanoid entity inspired by the 'Weeping Angel' archetype. It only moves when unobserved â€” freezing the instant it's seen. The system uses client-synced line-of-sight checks, humanoid animation states, and proximity triggers. Designed for tension, immersion, and strategic fear, this dummy is not a placeholder â€” it's a mechanic.
GAME_001.author: Kentiq

SFX_001.name: Kentiq SFX Pack #1 (Little Version)
SFX_001.description: A curated selection of original sound effects crafted by Kentiq â€” perfect for menus, UI feedback, transitions, sci-fi interfaces, and immersive game atmospheres. This Little Version offers free-to-use high-quality WAV/OGG clips for prototyping and production. Each sound is layered, clean, and ready for drop-in use.
SFX_001.license: ğŸ†“ Free for commercial & personal use
SFX_001.author: Kentiq

VFX_003.name: Astral
VFX_003.description: A colossal tentacled cosmic entity â€” phasing in and out of reality with every breath. Its form is barely contained by the laws of space, warping light and geometry around it. Astral is more than a visual â€” it's a presence. Designed for cataclysmic appearances, boss intros, or interdimensional events, this VFX blurs the line between beauty and existential terror.
VFX_003.author: Kentiq

UIX_001.name: Stylized Death Screen
UIX_001.description: A dynamic death screen designed to feel more like a psychological imprint than a basic game over. Featuring animated sprite sheet sequences, randomized taunting/fatalist quotes (including Japanese), and a reactive blackout overlay. Audio and visual triggers are perfectly synced for immersion. Ideal for rogue-lite, horror, or stylistic action games where death is part of the ritual.
UIX_001.author: Kentiq

SCENE_002.name: Real-Time Ocean System
SCENE_002.description: A MeshPart rigged with bones, forming a real-time ocean surface. The wave motion is generated through sinusoidal simulation formulas, creating a foundational and stylized representation of a dynamic sea. Currently in its early stages, focusing on the core animation mechanics.
SCENE_002.author: Kentiq

VFX_004.name: Turing Refractive Morphogenesis
VFX_004.description: A visualization of Alan Turing's morphogenesis theory, but with a twist: the patterns are generated by simulating light refraction through a dense medium. Rendered frame by frame, it's a computational artwork where physics dictates the emergence of organic, ever-shifting forms. Not just an effect, but a window into a different kind of natural law.
VFX_004.author: Kentiq

GAME_002.name: Dynamic Instanced Housing System
GAME_002.description: A comprehensive instanced housing system, engineered for performance and scalability. It features dynamic interior spawning, a sleek 3D UI, a robust networking pipeline for transitions, and deep runtime customization. Persistence is managed via ProfileService, saving all player data from ownership to furniture placement. With 3400 lines of code, it's a production-ready solution for immersive player housing.
GAME_002.author: Kentiq

GAME_003.name: Weeping Angel Horde
GAME_003.description: An enhanced and sophisticated version of the Weeping Angel. Features: Stealthy cloning to create a horde, collective immobilization of the horde when any member is observed, and wall auto-detection to prevent exploit glitches.
GAME_003.author: Kentiq
